contentrichtext.text: {{for|the album by Emery|The Question (Emery album)}} {{unreferenced|date=September 2012}} {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = The Question | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[The Slackers]] | Cover = Slackers_Question.jpg | Released = 1998 | Recorded = ???? | Genre = Ska | Length = 1:08:04 | Label = [[Hellcat Records]] | Producer = [[Vic Ruggiero]] | Last album = ''[[Redlight (album)|Redlight]]''<br/>(1997) | This album = ''''''''The Question''''''''<br/>(1998) | Next album = ''[[Before There Were Slackers There Were...]]''<br/>(1999) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{rating|4|5}} [{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r378773|pure_url=yes}} link] | noprose = yes }} '''''The Question''''' is an album by [[The Slackers]], released on November 20, 1998 (see [[1998 in music]]) on [[Hell-Cat Records]]. The record is dedicated to Tommy McCook and Dick Qualiana. ==Track listing== All songs written by [[Vic Ruggiero]], except where noted. # "Manuel" – 2:42 # "Knowing" – 2:53 # "Have the Time" – 3:07 # "And I Wonder?" ([[Dave Hillyard]], Ruggiero) – 3:49 # "No More Crying" – 4:32 # "Feed My Girl" (Marcus Geard, Marq Lyn) – 3:39 # "Mountainside" ([[Glen Pine]]) – 2:47 # "The Mummy" – 3:21 # "Motor City" (Hillyard, Ruggerio) – 4:00 # "Power" (Hillyard, Ruggerio, Lyn) – 4:26 # "Keep Him Away" – 2:49 # "The Question" – 3:59 # "The Question (Version)" – 4:04 # "Face in My Crowd" (Hillyard, Ruggerio) – 3:13 # "Do You Know" (Luis Zuluaga) – 3:10 # "Yes It's True" – 4:16 # "Alone Again" – 3:02 # "Make Me Smile" (T.J. Scanlon) – 4:20 # "No Love" (Hillyard) – 3:53 ==External links== * [http://www.theslackers.com/mp3s/TheSlackers-HaveTheTime.mp3 Audio] {{Slackers Albums}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Question, The}} [[Category:1998 albums]] [[Category:The Slackers albums]] {{1990s-rock-album-stub}}
